identification.cap: 1.97-5.91 inches, convex to flat, moist smooth, white to pinkish-buff with warts, bruises pinkish-buff.
identification.gills: Free to adnexed, close/crowded, white to pallid, bruises faintly pinkish.
identification.stem: 2.36-5.91 inches tall, 0.59-1.38 inches thick, equal/tapering with bulbous base, striate, pinkish-brown scales, white ring, bruises pinkish-reddish.
identification.microscopic: Spores 7-11 × 5.5-7 µm elliptical smooth amyloid; basidia 4-spored; pileipellis ixocutis 2-8 µm; lamellar trama bilateral; KOH negative on cap.

habitat: Ectomycorrhizal with coast live oak, Douglas-fir; solitary/scattered/gregarious; late fall to early spring; California to Oregon, Washington, southern British Columbia, New Mexico.
conservation: Least Concern, widespread in oak forests, no threats identified.
